items.title: The time to vote in NOW. The results of the election will impact...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

The time to vote in NOW. The results of the election will impact us, our families, and our communities. Learn more about candidates‚Äô positions on critical civil liberties issues and what Colorado ballot initiatives to look out for. Visit our 2020 Voter Guide at www.aclu-co.org/voterguide.

This is an all-mail election. All ballots must be received, not postmarked, by 7 p.m. on November 3. Mail your ballot no later than October 26 or return your ballot at a drop box.

items.title: All registered Colorado voters should have received their ballot...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

All registered Colorado voters should have received their ballot in the mail by now. If you are registered to vote in Colorado and still haven't received a ballot, contact your County Clerk ASAP. Contacting your County Clerk will ensure that you get your ballot for the 2020 election.

Find your County Clerk's info at: https://www.sos.state.co.us/‚Ä¶/‚Ä¶/CountyClerkRosterWebsite.pdf

Visit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information

items.title: How can we reimagine a society free from police violence? Join...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

How can we reimagine a society free from police violence? Join us today at noon as we discuss a new path forward to keep our communities safe: https://bit.ly/2GYYUUD #CommunityNotCops

items.title: It's tragic that it took a global emergency for actors in...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

It's tragic that it took a global emergency for actors in Colorado's criminal legal system to work together to reduce the number of people in jail. It would be even more tragic if we walk away from this pandemic having learned nothing. Read our report: https://bit.ly/371MTZt

items.title: IMPORTANT: Due to a court ruling, TODAY is the LAST DAY to...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

IMPORTANT: Due to a court ruling, TODAY is the LAST DAY to participate in the 2020 Census. It‚Äôs important that EVERYONE is counted. It is a right that is protected by law. Ask 3 friends if they‚Äôve filled out their forms. Go to http://2020Census.gov.

items.title: Even as jail populations are down, crime rates remain level...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Even as jail populations are down, crime rates remain level statewide and pretrial misconduct remains low. In Colorado‚Äôs 14 largest counties, there was a 4% drop in crime between 2019 and 2020. Colorado doesn't have to choose between public safety and public health. Read our report: http://bit.ly/371MTZt

items.title: Colorado's jail populations dropped by 46% during the...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Colorado's jail populations dropped by 46% during the pandemic. Colorado has an opportunity to save lives, money, families and jobs, all while honoring the promise of our Constitutional presumption of innocence. Read our new report on jail depopulation: http://bit.ly/371MTZt

items.title: October 26 is the last suggested day to return a ballot through...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

October 26 is the last suggested day to return a ballot through the mail. After this date, voters should visit a drop box or vote center to drop off their ballot.

All voters who vote at the polls must provide identification. If you are voting by mail for the first time, you may also need to provide a photocopy of your identification when you return your mail ballot. Check the Secretary of State website for all forms of acceptable identification. Some include:

-A valid Colorad...o driver‚Äôs license
-A valid U.S. passport
-A valid U.S. military identification card
-Certified documentation of naturalization

For more info on acceptable forms of voter ID, visit https://www.sos.state.co.us/‚Ä¶/elections/vote/acceptableForm‚Ä¶

See MoreVisit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information

items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

We‚Äôre fighting for abortion rights, immigrants‚Äô rights, disability rights, LGBTQ rights, and an end to our broken system of mass incarceration. What about you? #OurVoteOurFight www.aclu.org/ourvoteourfight

items.title: Join us tomorrow at noon as Elisabeth Epps leads us in...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Join us tomorrow at noon as Elisabeth Epps leads us in discussion about the best path forward in our vision for community safety: https://bit.ly/2GYYUUD #DivestFromPolicing

items.title: "The ACLU of Colorado believes that the right of free...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

"The ACLU of Colorado believes that the right of free speech includes your right, at your own home, to post a sign or fly a flag that expresses your views. We are investigating complaints that HOAs have objected when residents have displayed pride flags or Black Lives Matter yard signs.

Has your homeowners association (HOA) or Metro District sent you a recent violation letter or threatened a fine because you were flying a certain flag or posted a certain sign in your yard? If... you believe your HOA or Metro District is infringing on your right of free expression, please contact the ACLU of Colorado at HOAfreespeech@aclu-co.org.

In your email, please let us know:
‚Ä¢ The name of your subdivision, HOA, or metro district;
‚Ä¢ What flag or sign your HOA or Metro District objected to; and
‚Ä¢ The reason they provided for that objection.

Please also provide us with any violation letter or notice that you received, as well as your contact information.

To learn more, visit: https://aclu-co.org/hoa-infringement-your-rights-regarding‚Ä¶/

See More

items.title: Our new report finds that in an unprecedented move to protect...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Our new report finds that in an unprecedented move to protect public health, Sheriffs across the state worked to safely decrease jail populations with 6,000 fewer people sleeping in jail each night & over 20,000 more people living free each month. Read the full report: http://bit.ly/371MTZt

items.title: In three months, jail populations dropped to levels not seen in...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

In three months, jail populations dropped to levels not seen in almost thirty years. COVID-19 jail depopulation has shown that we know how to quickly, dramatically & safely free thousands of people from behind bars. The time to build a better CO is now. Read our report: https://aclu-co.org/‚Ä¶/aclu_decarcerationreport_100720_final‚Ä¶

items.title: In Colorado, you are eligible to vote if you:  ‚úÖ Will be 18...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

In Colorado, you are eligible to vote if you:

‚úÖ Will be 18 years of age or older at the time of the election
‚úÖ Are a U.S. citizen
‚úÖ Have resided in Colorado 22 days immediately before the election...
‚úÖ If you are absent while in military service or while attending college, you are still eligible to vote in the state of Colorado

For more info on voter eligibility, visit https://www.sos.state.co.us/‚Ä¶/FAQs/VoterRegistrationFAQ.html

See MoreVisit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information

items.title: With federal protections for reproductive rights now...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

With federal protections for reproductive rights now precariously uncertain, it is more urgent than ever that the states safeguard access to abortion care. But in Colorado, that access is under a real, imminent threat: Proposition 115, a measure that would ban abortion later in pregnancy is on the ballot this year.

This is all Coloradans are asking for: to control our own bodies, and our own futures. With Justice Ginsburg now gone, it falls on all of us to honor her legacy by continuing that fight. In Colorado, that means voting ‚ÄúNO‚Äù on Proposition 115.

Proposition 115 shows no compassion for what families face in unimaginably complicated circumstances and takes away the ability of doctors to provide the best medical care for their patients.

aclu.org

The Right to Abortion is on the Ballot in Colorado This November

Proposition 115 shows no compassion for what families face in unimaginably complicated circumstances and takes away the ability of doctors to provide the best medical care for their patients.Proposition 115 shows no compassion for what families face in unimaginably complicated circumstances and takes away the ability of doctors to provide the best medical care for their patients.
